meanings.sent1: The farmers were diking the fields to protect them from flooding.
meanings.sent2: Every year, the community comes together to help with diking the riverbanks.
meanings.sent3: Why did the beaver start diking the stream? To show off its engineering skills!
meanings.sent4: She was diking her emotions, trying to hold back the flood of tears.
meanings.sent5: The workers were diking with such precision, it was like watching a dance of earth and water.

meanings.definition: The act of constructing or repairing dikes.
meanings.sent1: After the heavy rain, the diking of the coastal area was crucial to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent2: The diking along the river was a community effort to protect the town.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best diking project brought out the creativity in the engineers.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a diking of support, holding back the emotional overflow.
meanings.sent5: The diking stood strong against the force of the water, a testament to human ingenuity.
